snippet: The violations of privacy rules, which were often inadvertent, cast new light on the agency’s potential for intrusions on Americans’ communications.
abstract: Documents leaked by Edward J Snowden show that National Security Agency violated privacy rules protecting communications of Americans and others on domestic soil 2,776 times over a one-year period, shedding new light on agency's intrusions into Americans' privacy.
lead_paragraph: The violations of privacy rules, which were often inadvertent, cast new light on the agency’s potential for intrusions on Americans’ communications.

headline.main: N.S.A. Often Broke Rules on Privacy, Audit Shows
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Often Broke Rules On Privacy, Audit Shows

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
